I had seen this elderly gentleman before. A few months ago he was   _   cans and bottles from the recycle bins behind my house. A   _   like this is not normal. I was shocked to see this and I was sad by the fact that he had to do this to   _  . One rainy day in the spring I saw him again riding his bike with bags of   _   attached to his backpack and handle-bars. My heart   _  . I felt powerless thinking I could never   _   with him. So you can imagine my   _   when I see him again. I walked over to him and managed to   _   a very quiet "Hi".
  _  , I had never approached anyone like this before. His back was turned to me and he didn't   _  . I decided it was because he didn't want to be   _  . So I kept walking. And then I   _   the big bag of cans and bottles we had all collected from our west coast trip. "He can have those!" I thought and walked back over to him. I told him if he   _   there I could get him some more bottles. He said, "That would be very much   _  ." I came back in 5 minutes and there he was in the shade waiting. I handed the bag to him and   _   that it wasn't much. And then with another large bright   _   he said, "Every little bit   _  . Thank you so much. And, have a great day."
